page.title: 03Barrinton Hall
page.content: Barrintgotn Hall was built in the late 17th century for Thomas Berdysle on the site of a 15th century house. The earliest manor house mentioned in the Domesday Book of 1086 was situated just at the rear of the hall. The only evidence is the homestead moat. In 1955 Eastwoods bought the hall to convert into a central laboratory, but this plan was not carried out. In 1958 it was let to tenants who started a school specialising in preparing for Cambridge Entrance Exam, but this caused considerable annoyance to to the people of the village. In 1966 Rugby Portland Cement used it as an Eastern Area Sales Office. In 1979 major renovations and complete refurbishing of the interior took place.
